message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.DB

The paper deals with probabilistic reasoning in natural language processing (NLP) and proposes a formal description of probabilistic context free grammars (PCFG) driven by multi entity bayesian networks (MEBN). This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Computation and Language (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper discusses the usage of upper ontology like Probabilistic Ontology Web Language (PR-OWL) built using MEBN, which indicates a possible connection to Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also deals with uncertainty reasoning, which is a common topic in Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes an approach to resolve prepositional phrase (PP) attachment ambiguity, which is a problem in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and can be related to the sub-category of Databases (cs.DB).
